About Me

Bio

My name is Adam Ferguson. I am a self-taught freelance web developer currently volunteering at Mandalay Wellbeing CIC where I maintain and develop their many websites such as wolhss.co.uk. I have strong knowledge of both HTML5 and CSS3 as well as experience and an understanding of both Bootstrap 4 and Sass. I am very adaptive and eager to learn; striving to expand upon my skills every day. One of the ways in which I accomplish this is by completing various courses on Udemy, you can View My Certificates Here. I'm very passionate about creating new and challenging projects that push the boundaries of what I know, allowing me to build upon and gain a more thorough understanding of my skills.


I completed my secondary school education with 10 GCSEs A-C, including both Maths and English; I went on to study BTEC Level 3 Subsidiary Diploma (programming) at college in which I received a distinction*; this is where I discovered my love for coding. I have always enjoyed pushing boundaries and believe 'variety is the spice of life'.
